thread.title: #Thisflag pastor arrested on return to Zimbabwe from US
thread.title_full: #Thisflag pastor arrested on return to Zimbabwe from US

title: #Thisflag pastor arrested on return to Zimbabwe from US
text:
Print 
Evan Mawarire was previously arrested and charged last July, but was freed by a magistrate's court which said police had not followed procedure. 
Harrison Nkomo, his lawyer, said the pastor had been arrested at Harare's airport and was taken to the capital's central police station. Zimbabwe data prices, a frontline in anti-Mugabe protests 
Police spokeswoman Charity Charamba confirmed Mawarire's arrest, saying he had an outstanding warrant after failing to appear in court last year. She did not provide more details. 
"The law will always catch up with you even if you go away. Mawarire had a warrant of arrest against him," Charamba said. Bob's sold Zimbabwe to Chinese: Protesters 
After he was freed by the court in July, police had said they still wanted to file more charges against Mawarire. He travelled to South Africa and then the United States, where he had been living with his family since July. 
His absence drew condemnation from supporters, who accused him of abandoning them when his leadership was needed. Zimbabwe drops plan to cut jobs and bonuses 
Mawarire rose to fame after posting a video online last year that went viral, venting his anger about deteriorating social and economic conditions in Zimbabwe and urging citizens to hold the government to account. 
The preacher's social media movement #ThisFlag rattled Mugabe's administration, leading to accusations by the state against Mawarire of inciting public violence. (Reporting by MacDonald Dzirutwe; Editing by James Macharia and Mark Trevelyan) Share Tweet SHARE YOUR OPINION If you have an opinion you would like to share on this article, please to the Times LIVE iLIVE team.
